result.name: routes-onto-employment-and-support-allowance-dataset
result.notes: Anonymised dataset from a two-wave survey of people who claimed Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) between April and June 2009. The first wave was a face-to-face survey of 3,650 people conducted between December 2009 and February 2010. Participants who agreed to be contacted again for the study were also interviewed in the follow-up survey conducted between July and September 2010: 1,842 people took part. Survey looks at factors leading to ESA claims and information about the social characteristics of people who claim ESA, including their employment and labour market experiences.

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions
